org.apparatus_templi

Class SimpleHttpServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.SimpleHttpServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public class SimpleHttpServer
extends Object
implements Runnable
    A simple web server that acts as both a middle man between the Coordinator and any front ends, as well as a host for the bundled web front end. The web server is implemented as a HttpsServer and defines a series of HttpHandlers that handle requests for virtual documents.
    Author:
    Jonathan Nelson , Christopher Hagler

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleHttpServer(int portNumber)
      Start the web server bound to the loop-back interface on the given port number.
      SimpleHttpServer(int portNumber, boolean autoIncrement)
      Start the web server bound to the loop-back interface on the given port if possible, optionally binding to a different port if the given port number is not available.
      SimpleHttpServer(int portNumber, boolean autoIncrement, boolean bindLocalhost)
      Start the web server on the given port number if available, optionally binding to either the loop-back interface or the localhost interface, optionally attempting to find the next available port number if the port specified is not available.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleHttpServer

        public SimpleHttpServer(int portNumber)
        Start the web server bound to the loop-back interface on the given port number. If the port number is already in use then the server will not attempt to find the next available port and will trigger a terminal failure.
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the port number the server should bind to

      • SimpleHttpServer

        public SimpleHttpServer(int portNumber,
                boolean autoIncrement)
        Start the web server bound to the loop-back interface on the given port if possible, optionally binding to a different port if the given port number is not available.
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the port number the server will attempt to bind to
        autoIncrement - if true then the server will attempt to find the next available port if the one specified is not available. If false, and the given port number is not available, then the server will shutdown the service with a terminal failure.

      • SimpleHttpServer

        public SimpleHttpServer(int portNumber,
                boolean autoIncrement,
                boolean bindLocalhost)
        Start the web server on the given port number if available, optionally binding to either the loop-back interface or the localhost interface, optionally attempting to find the next available port number if the port specified is not available.
        Parameters:
        portNumber - the port number to attempt to bind to.
        autoIncrement - if true the server will attempt to find the next available port if the specified one is not available. If false, and the given port number is not available, then the server will shutdown the service with a terminal failure.
        bindLocalhost - if true then the server will bind to both the localhost interface, and will be visible to other computers on the same network. If false then the server will bind to the loopback interface and will only be visible on the same computer running the service.

    • Method Detail

      • terminate

        void terminate()
        Notify the web server that it should terminate all current connections and exit its run() method.

      • setResourceFolder

        public void setResourceFolder(String path)
        Set the path of the web resource folder used by the front-end. This folder will be used as the top level for all resource requests.
        Parameters:
        path - the path of the website resources

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the port number the server is bound to.

      • getServerLocation

        public String getServerLocation()
        Returns the String representation of the current server address. This address should either be \"localhost\" or an IP address (i.e. \"192.168.0.1\").
        Returns:
        The String representation of the current address.

      • getProtocol

        public String getProtocol()
        Returns the protocol type
        Returns:
        one of "http://" or "https://"

      • run

        public void run()
        Main loop of the web service. Constantly check if the service should terminate and, if not, sleep for a short time. If the server should terminate then the internal HttpsServer is stopped and the run() method will exit.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable
